topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee56dc6368725a001f1100#post_54ee56dc6368725a001f1100

It's slow as absolute shit. I don't know what the technical reason for it is, but every time you enter a battle, there's a noticeable lag between your attack and the attack's effect.


"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee56f26368723e2d350900#post_54ee56f26368723e2d350900

I think that Pokemon is built so that nearly every (evolved) Pokemon can somehow be used competitively (well, maybe except the extraordinarily weak ones, like Furret). It just takes a lot of work and a little bit of luck.

And it won't stop competitive trainers from shaming you because logic.

topics.body:
Fun fact - Barbie was the first children's doll molded with female breasts. Before then, only "adult" novelty dolls came with breasts. Naturally, there was an uproar by concerned parents ("Think of the children!"), but I guess children's interest in the doll peaked to the point where Mattel could eventually overcome this barrier.

I read a huge book on Barbie's creation; for those of you who don't know, I really like children's dolls. Consider it a strange hobby.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.author: 505696b47f123b37e800effa

topics.body:
I know you guys get annoyed whenever I talk about league and it's a completely different franchise, but reason why I play league all the time instead:
I could totally play as Riven instead and get 40 kills straight, but do I?  No.  I don't like Riven.  I play as Ahri all the time instead; sure I only get 5 to 10 kills instead, but I can still play pretty decently as her.  Do you ever only ever see Rivens on teams competively?  No; not every team in every match has a Riven or Nasus, cause the majority of players have champions that they play as cause they like them.  If your champion is underpowered, but the player is skilled enough you can still win in a competitive match; your champion can be a complete washout and still stand a very decent chance of winning if you're skilled enough.


I love LoL, cause to prove my point the bots use the meta (basically imagine if pokemon bots played according to smogon) and the bots in LoL suck ass hard and everyone kicks the living shit out of them.  The person you're playing against could be completely stacked against you and you could still win if you're a skilled player.


So am I ever going to play pokemon again?  HELL NO!
I don't like games where the game is fundamentally impossible to win against other players if you play with characters you like.


Pokemon fans can go "well it's fun if you sacrifice what you as a person find fun in games and play completely differently from a way you enjoy" all they want I'm not going to play pokemon cause I don't want to play a game that I can't find enjoyment out of.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
